content: v_stitch vortex i ve been admiring all the knitted boomerang shawls on ravelry for ages and wanting to make a crochet one here s the result just like its knitted equivalent this shawl is worked sideways from one skinny end to form a distorted triangle becoming wider as you increase every row on one edge but only decrease every second row on the other edge the stitch unit for this shawl is the v_stitch double_crochet chain double_crochet and the asymmetric increasing/decreasing forms a vortex hence the v_stitch vortex you can use any yarn and hook combination you like that gives you a drapey lacy fabric abbreviations and special stitches i have used standard us terminology v-st = v_stitch = double_crochet chain double_crochet in space indicated v-st-increase = v_stitch increase = double_crochet chain double_crochet chain double_crochet in space indicated ch3-space = chain 3 space magic_ring = magic_ring materials yarn approximately 90 gr / 400 m of light fingering weight such as milford soft 3ply cotton hook - 3 mm or size that gives you the fabric you want size 140 cm on the long curved edge 33 cm at deepest point gauge gauge is not critical for this project just choose a hook which give you the fabric you want instructions increase at the end of each odd numbered row and the beginning of each even numbered row decrease at the end of each even numbered row by ignoring the last ch4-double_crochet v_stitch repeating row 5 and 6 you gradually increase the number of v-stitches and so the length of the row stop when the shawl is the size you like for me that was about 140cm pretty much my arm span finish with a row 6 then work the last row as shown the single_crochet following the chain 3 double_crochet forms a shell edge to match the shells on the ends of the odd numbered row of course if you prefer a straight edge finish just finish after a row 5 repeat foundation start with a magic_ring or just 5 chain instead of 4 row 1 ch4 v-st into the magic_ring or just v-st into 5th chain from hook if you re not using magic_ring turn 2 v-stitches row 2 ch3 v-st-increase in 1st v-st v-st in last v-st turn 3 v-stitches row 3 ch4 double_crochet in 1st v-st v-st in next v-st v-st-increase in last v-st double_crochet in ch3-space turn 4 v-stitches row 4 ch3 v-st-increase in 1st v-st v-st in each v-st across row ignoring the last v-st formed by ch4 double_crochet that started previous row turn 4 v-stitches row 5 ch4 double_crochet in 1st v-st v-st in each v-st across working a v-st-increase in last v-st double_crochet in ch3-space turn row 6 ch3 v-st-increase in 1st v-st v-st in each v-st across row ignoring the last v-st formed by ch4 double_crochet that started the previous row turn finishing off cut the yarn and weave in the ends and secure them thoroughly with a darning needle pattern copyright
